author: Michael Larabel
description: Richard Hughes of Red Hat announced the availability today of Fwupd 2.0.15 as the latest increment to this open-source firmware updating solution built around the Linux Vendor Firmware Service (LVFS)...
title: Fwupd 2.0.15 Released With Support For Newer NVIDIA ConnectX NICs

author: Michael Larabel
description: Linus Torvalds recently marked Bcachefs as "externally maintained" and isn't merging any new Bcachefs code for the time being but for now at least is keeping the existing Bcachefs code in-tree for anyone that has been relying on this experimental CoW file-system from prior kernel versions. OpenSUSE announced today though they are resorting to disabling the kernel driver in their Linux 6.17+ builds...
title: openSUSE Disabling Bcachefs Support For Its Linux 6.17+ Kernel Builds

author: Michael Larabel
description: Hyprland 0.51 is now available as the latest feature release for this unique Wayland compositor...
title: Hyprland 0.51 Compositor Released With Reworked Gesture System, New Animations

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Zink OpenGL-on-Vulkan driver is well optimized for Linux gaming and desktop use thanks to the work by Mike Blumenkrantz being funded by Valve. Zink has even worked with OpenCL thanks to Rusticl and now another frontier is being conquered for this generic OpenGL on Vulkan driver: workstation graphics with optimizing around the SPECViewPerf test cases...
title: Zink Begins Optimizing For Workstation Graphics With SPECViewPerf: Doubles The Perf

author: Michael Larabel
description: Pogocache is the open-source fast caching software built from scratch that is optimized for low latency and CPU scalability/efficiency. Pogocache claims to outperform Memcached, Valkey, Redis, and other alternatives. Out today is Pogocache 1.2 as the newest feature release for this fast cache...
title: Pogocache 1.2 Now Uses Microsoft's Mimalloc By Default: "Excellent Performance"

author: Michael Larabel
description: Linux kernel developers are evaluating the idea of removing HIGHPTE support from the Linux kernel due to its maintenance burden and just one ARM system currently using it...
title: Linux Looking To Finally Kill Off HIGHPTE Support

author: Michael Larabel
description: The newest Direct Rendering Manager (DRM) display driver that has been in the works for the Linux kernel is "Yhgch" from Inspur...
title: The Newest DRM Display Driver Being Worked On For Linux: "Yhgch"
